result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Charles Wichelmann

10:51 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Steven Charles Wichelmann appeared. Includes 22CF142 and 22CF399. Court questions non-appearance. Atty Selmer states DE had COVID and DE doesn't currently have a cellphone, as it was seized, and requests to address. Court reviews files and notes DE hasn't been testing as required. Court states prelim is needed in 22CF399. Court sets Preliminary Hearing on 22CF399 before Court Commissioner and STC in 22CF142. Atty Selmer requests DE's phone be released. ADA Brekken responds and states phone cannot be returned, as it may have evidentiary value. Atty Selmer requests to modify reporting to JSC. Court orders Defendant to report to JSC on Tuesdays and Fridays, rather than reporting every day to JSC and amends bonds in 22CF317 and 22CF142. Adjourned at 11:05 AM.  gll  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

*AMENDED*

Includes 22CF142 and 22CF317.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to drug testing 2 times per week on Tuesdays and Fridays by 4:00 PM. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

Adjourned: 1:56 PM. kma
